BaseFlowManager

@objc
open class BaseFlowManager : NSObject

Flow Manager class which handles reading application flow from configuration json and manage different state transitions

Since

Since 1.1.0
  • appFlowModel

    State flow model as defined in the json

    Since

    Since 1.1.0

    Declaration

    Swift

    public fileprivate(set) var appFlowModel: AppFlowModel!

  • getBackState(_:)

    To get the State when custom navigation back button has been pressed.

    Throws

    Error of type FlowManagerErrors which tells the error faced by Flow Manager to get the state to go to for custom back

    Since

    Since 1.1.0

    Declaration

    Swift

    public func getBackState(_ forState: BaseState) throws -> BaseState?

    Parameters

    forState

    The current state of the app

    Return Value

    An instance of BaseState which is the next state to navigate

  • getBackState()

    To get the State when custom navigation back button has been pressed. This by default takes the current State of the app

    Throws

    Error of type FlowManagerErrors which tells the error faced by Flow Manager to get the state to go to for custom back

    Since

  • getNextState(_:)

    Returns next state for the specified state. This takes the current State by default

    Throws

    Error of type FlowManagerErrors which tells the error faced by Flow Manager to get the state to go to on the Event

    Since

    Since 1.1.0

    Declaration

    Swift

    public func getNextState(_ forEventId: String?) throws -> BaseState?

    Parameters

    forEventId

    The event Id of the click

    Return Value

    The next state to load

  • getNextState(_:forEventId:)
